results.title: [Rotorua]
results.brief_description: Incomplete film with no title describing New Zealand. Shows footage of town of Rotorua and varius geysers and mud pools, Maori children at play in thermal pools, Maori women cooking over steaming geysers. Accompanied by explanatory narration. Also includes footage of Waikato River but film abruptly stops in mid-sentence.

results.title: [Rice growing and distribution in Australia]
results.brief_description: Silent film showing the process of rice growing in Australia and its storage and distribution. Printed shot-list accompanying the film indicates “Victorian Railways” and suggested script. Silent film with no title, intertitles or credits. To quote from the shot-list “…Rice is grown under irrigation in the Murrumbidgee, Coleambally and Murray Valley districts of NSW and, near Townsville in Queensland. From a humble beginning, the industry has prospered, reaching a production of 284,000 tons of rice harvested in 1971. The average yield of Australian rice is the highest in the world 3 tons of grain per acre.”

results.title: [Reginald Relf]
results.creator_credit: Reginald Relf, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reginald Relf tells of his time in the Royal Australian Air Force, training as a mechanic at RMIT in Melbourne. Later he was posted in Queensland, tracking aircraft flying to and from New Guinea. As well as sharing his experiences of this time, he tells of his joy and relief when war ended.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reginald Relf, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: [Queen who returned Compilation]
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Features three films of Royal visits between 1954 and 1963. 1.”Royal Visit to Melbourne” - Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. 2.”Queen who Returned” - Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, visits Victoria. 3.”Royal Visit” - Queen Elizabeth and the Duke on tour in Victoria.

results.title: [Prize winning advertising films]
results.brief_description: Four short advertising films which were awarded prizes at an International Advertising Film Festival. 1. ‘Awarded prize for animated models and objects’ - cigarette advertisement by Joop Geesink and Pearl and Dean (Holland and Great Britain). Commercial for de Reske cigarettes entitled ‘No Tax on Tips’. 2. ‘Awarded prize for live action up to 40 metres’ - Spart (France) ‘Chacun a son Tour’ commercial for Ovomaltine. 3. ‘Awarded prize for live action 41 to 80 metres’ - Insel Film (West Germany) for Stenorette dictating machine entitled ‘ Leiden und Freuden’. 4. ‘Awarded prize for live action over 80 metres - Slogan Film (Italy) for supercortemaggiore Petrol and Energol oil. Made for A.C.I.P. entitled ‘40 Anni Dopo’.

results.title: [Principles of respiratory mechanics. Part I]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the mechanical behaviour of the lungs in normal and pathological states. Using animated drawings and both normal subjects and patients with respiratory conditions, discusses such basic concepts as elastic and resistive properties of the lungs and pressure volume relationships.

results.title: [Princess Alexandra in Hong Kong]
results.creator_credit: Warner-Pathe News and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Highlights of Princess Alexandra’s visit to Hong Kong during November-December 1961. Records some of the formal engagements of the tour and some informal occasions when the Princess was the guest of the Chinese community.

results.title: [Postmaster General's Department: dead letter office]
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives of letters sent to the “dead letter office”. Sends a message out to the people of Victoria to put their name and address on the back of posted envelopes.
